quizzes.title: Sports Quiz: Expression and Ship
quizzes.description: Test your sports knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Sports, hedonists, origin. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This expression appeared when sea voyages were the only way to travel a great distance. There were women who gave birth on the ship, usually at the forward deck behind the main cannon.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Son of a gun

questions.question: This romantic comedy, starring Will Smith, was released in 2005.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hitch

questions.question: This expression comes from the 17th century when wooden planks were attached to the side of a ship. When a sailor had to go out and fix something outside the ship he was at danger of falling in the water.

options.text: Between the devil and the deep blue sea
Got out of the wrong side of bed

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Between the devil and the deep blue sea

questions.question: The origin of this expression comes from the 9th century. People then paid high taxes and if they did not pay, their nose was cut off.

options.text: Money is the root of all evil

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pay through the nose

questions.question: He was born Vernon Louis Gomez.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lefty Gomez

questions.question: This idiom was initiated by popular card games in the past.  It was often used when a throw was out of play or not lying flat; in this case, the throw was considered not valid.

options.text: Not playing with a full deck

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No dice

questions.question: He was born Gordon Matthew Sumner in Wallsend, Northumberland.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sting

questions.question: This expression evolved around the 14th century when pins were invented.  Pin makers then offered pins for general sale, only on the 1st and 2nd of January. The upper class women would get an allowance from their husbands to buy pins.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pin money

questions.question: Ive got an itch, because he ______ my watch. I am never going to find this thief.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Snitched

questions.question: This expression became popular first among the hedonists of the early 19th century. Opium pipe smoking was fashionable among them.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pipe dream

questions.question: What animal are the Canary Islands named after?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dog

questions.question: This expression originates from the Bible. There Jesus tells a story about a man who stored a lot of food for months and years to come. When he finally told himself he had enough, he died. That is why God referred to him as a fool because he stored all the stuff in vain - he could not take it with him in the afterlife.

options.text: Dont Bite the hand that feeds you

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eat, drink, and be merry

questions.question: This idiom originated from a sorcerer who prepared his magic with his hands over the table and not below, where nothing could be seen and he could easily conceal any trickery.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Above board

questions.question: This phrase means, a day during which nothing seems to be going right.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bad hair day

questions.question: The original version of this idiom was to beat the pistol. It became popular in the early 1900s when it was referred a race before the starter fired the pistol.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jump the gun

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Movie and Film
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, sarah, awards. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What was the name of the plumber in The Golden Girls, who brought the ladies the new Standard Lowboy toilet?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lou

questions.question: What did Stan Zbornak from The Golden Girls lose, while he was travelling to the girls house in his Corvette?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: his toupee

questions.question: In 1984 this film, written by George Lucas, directed by Steven Spielberg and starring Harrison Ford, was criticised for being too violent and scary. When making its sequel, Spielberg apologized for the poor quality of the film.

options.text: Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom
Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom

questions.question: This 1984 comedy started a successful franchise under which 6 hilarious sequels, an animated TV series and a live-action TV series appeared.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Police Academy

questions.question: This 1985 release is the first action film starring Schwarzenegger, where the actor shows his sense of humour. The movie is about a retired commando who has just a couple of hours to save his daughter from an exiled dictator. The movie grossed $57 million worldwide.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Commando

questions.question: This 1986 fairy-tale-like movie is about Sarah, who unwillingly babysits her brother. As he keeps on crying, she inadvertently summons the goblins to free her from the boy. After all, they take him away and she has only 13 hours to get her brother back, otherwise he will become a goblin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Labyrinth

questions.question: This movie, starring Michael Keaton, was released in U.S. theaters on June 23, 1989 and soon became the highest grossing movie of the year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Batman

questions.question: How long did Sophias marinara sauce take to make on the sitcom The Golden Girls?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 14 hours

questions.question: This 1985 action movie tells a story about a former prisoner sent on a mission. He falls in love with his Vietnamese partner and when sadistic people kill her, the protagonist wants revenge, while still focusing on his top secret mission.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rambo: First Blood Part II

questions.question: Released in 1986, this movie featured Tom Cruise and Val Kilmer, although the latter did not want to take part in the film -- he was forced to participate by contractual obligations.

options.text: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
Once Upon a Time in America

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Top Gun

questions.question: In 1986 when it was released, this movie became number one worldwide at the box office. The name of the animal included in its title was put in quotes for the American public, so that people did not think that the main character was this animal.  (quotes omitted in the answers)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Crocodile Dundee

questions.question: In 1984, when this film was released, it won 8 academy awards -: Best Picture, Best Actor, Best Director, Art Director, Costume Design, Best Make-up, Best Sound and Adapted Screenplay. It tells the story of a classical musicians life.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Amadeus

questions.question: Where did Blanche Devereaux from The Golden Girls work?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: at a museum

questions.question: Rose Nylund, one of the main characters in the series The Golden Girls, was from which small town?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: St. Olaf

questions.question: In 1982 this Steven Spielbergs sci-fi movie received 4 Oscars: Best Sound Effects Editing, Best Visual Effects, Best Score, and Best Sound. The main characters are three young children who help a space creature return home. So the greater part of the film was deliberately shot from a lower camera angle to enhance a childs point of view.

options.text: Close Encounters of the Third Kind

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Finding Nemo and Character
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, john, nickname. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the name of the pelican that Nemo, and later Marlin and Dory befriend in the film Finding Nemo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nigel

questions.question: On the popular sitcom The Golden Girls, Dorothy and Sophia dress up as which famous couple?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sonny and Cher

questions.question: On the sitcom The Golden Girls, after suffering a debilitating stroke, Sophia was put  in which nursing home?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shady Pines

questions.question: One of John Travoltas earliest roles was on the television series Welcome Back, Kotter. What was the first name of his character?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vinnie

questions.question: Which of these was NOT a character in Finding Nemo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sebastian

questions.question: Which of these words were NOT said by Dory, while she was talking in her sleep in Finding Nemo?

options.text: The sea monkey has my money...

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: P. Sherman, 42 Wallaby Way, Sydney...

questions.question: In the movie Finding Nemo, Crush, the sea turtle, told Marlin he was 150 years old.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In the animated movie Finding Nemo, before it stung her, Dory wanted to make a baby jellyfish her pet and she wanted to call it by what name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Squishy

questions.question: Who voiced Nemos father, Marlin in the animated film Finding Nemo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Albert Brooks

questions.question: In this movie, the main character Zack Mayo was portrayed by Richard Gere, after John Travolta turned down the role.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An Officer and a Gentleman

questions.question: This character from the film Phenomenon, portrayed by John Travolta, is a man who discovers he has super intelligence, after seeing a bright light on the evening of his 37th birthday.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Malley

questions.question: Which one of these actors did NOT lend their voice to a character from Finding Nemo?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nathan Lane

questions.question: This CBS series, which ran from September 1992 to May 1993, was a spin-off from The Golden Girls.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Golden Palace

questions.question: In Finding Nemo, what nickname was Nemo given during his initiation ceremony in the dentists fishtank?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sharkbait

questions.question: What year was Pixars computer-animated film Finding Nemo released?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2003

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: John Travolta and Film
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, john, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which actress plays the love interest of John Travoltas character in the film Urban Cowboy?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Debra Winger

questions.question: This event gathered more than 450 000 people at a pasture in Sullivan County in 1969. Love was free, drugs were freely distributed and people claimed to be open minded.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Woodstock festival

questions.question: This theory began a revolution in science. Postulated by Einstein, its basis was the identification of gravity with inertia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The theory of relativity

questions.question: This war took place between 1964 and 1975. The average age of the soldiers who lost their lives was 23.11 years.  Amputations and crippling wounds were 300 percent higher compared to previous wars.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vietnam War

questions.question: This was one of the deadliest tragedy of the century.  1,503 passengers and crew died in the North Atlantic, after this ship hit an iceberg on its maiden voyage in 1912.   It was the largest and supposedly the safest vessel in the world at the time.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Titanic

questions.question: This war was fought in almost every part of the world. More than 50 countries participated and an estimated 40 to 50 million people lost their lives.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: World War II

questions.question: In the film Look Whos Talking, John Travolta plays the part of James Ubriacco, a single man dating a woman with a baby. Who does the voice of baby Mikey, in the movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bruce Willis

questions.question: John Travolta was born in Englewood, New Jersey on what date?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: February 18th, 1954

questions.question: The first time a woman flew across the Atlantic was in 1928, when she was a passenger on the plane.  Later, in 1932, she did it again, this time she was the pilot.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Amelia Earhardt

questions.question: Released in 1977, this movie became the most profitable film in the history of Hollywood. It made its director, George Lucas $7 million richer
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Star Wars

questions.question: Its invention revolutionized the intimate lives of many women.  It contains synthetic hormones, which mimic the activity of estrogen and progestin in a womans body.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Pill

questions.question: Humanity made the gigantic leap to the moon in 1969, when his rocket took off from Kennedy Space Center in Florida.  Four days later, he was walking on the Moon.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Neil Armstrong

questions.question: John Travolta danced with the late Princess Diana at a White House dinner on 9 November 1985.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In the film Urban Cowboy, John Travolta plays a cowboy, who frequents which bar in Texas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gilleys

questions.question: One of the bloodiest events of the century, it cost the lives of 9 million people by its end in 1918.  It was brought about by the expansionist policy of Austria-Hungary, which conflicted with Serbian nationalism.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: World War I

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Man and Land
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, failure, sight. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Im not looking forward to jumping in after you. But like I said, I dont see a choice. I guess Im kinda hoping youll come back over the rail and get me off the hook here. (1997)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Titanic

questions.question: Do you mean to tell me, Katie Scarlett OHara, that Tara, that land doesnt mean anything to you? Why, land is the only thing in the world worth workin for, worth fightin for, worth dyin for, because its the only thing that lasts.  (1939)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gone With the Wind

questions.question: The main award of the Venice Film Festival is this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Golden Lion

questions.question: This is the total number of bones in the adult human body.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 206

questions.question: What have I ever done to make you treat me so disrespectfully? If youd come to me in friendship, then this scum that ruined your daughter would be suffering this very day. And if by chance an honest man like yourself should make enemies, then they would become my enemies. And then they would fear you.  (1972)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Godfather

questions.question: Leukemia is a disease harming this bodily system.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Immune system

questions.question: One of these novels is written by Gabriel Garcia Marquez.

options.text: The Old Man and the Sea

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: One Hundred Years of Solitude

questions.question: We who are about to die salute you. (2000)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gladiator

questions.question: What weve got here is failure to communicate. Some men you just cant reach, so you get what we had here last week which is the way he wants it. Well, he gets it. And I dont like it any more than you men. (1967)

options.text: One Flew Over the Cuckoos Nest

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cool Hand Luke

questions.question: No, Im all man. I even fought in WWII. Of course, I was wearing womens undergarments under my uniform. (1994)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ed Wood

questions.question: This man was not a US President.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alexander Hamilton

questions.question: First principles, Clarice. Read Marcus Aurelius. Of each particular thing ask: what is it in itself? What is its nature? What does he do, this man you seek?  (1991)

options.text: The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Silence of the Lambs

questions.question: I coulda had class. I coulda been a contender. I coulda been somebody, instead of a bum, which is what I am, lets face it. (1954)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: On The Waterfront

questions.question: This avenue bisects Manhattan Island.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fifth Avenue

questions.question: You hear me talkin, hillbilly boy? I aint through with you by a damn sight. Ima get medieval on your ass. (1994)
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pulp Fiction

quizzes.title: History Quiz: City and Emperor
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, peak, example. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: According to legends, this was the home city of Helen - the woman whose beauty triggered the Trojan War.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sparta

questions.question: Hannibal, best known for his achievements in the Second Punic War, was a politician and military commander of this ancient city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Carthage

questions.question: This city is the capital of Armenia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yerevan

questions.question: These are the first names of the Wright brothers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Orville and Wilbur

questions.question: This Chinese dynasty was founded by Shi Huangdi (which means First Emperor).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Qin Dynasty

questions.question: The Persian Empire reached its peak under this emperor.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Darius I

questions.question: The marriage between Henry VIII and this woman lasted about 6 months.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Anne of Cleves

questions.question: One of these Yoga terms means truth.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Satya

questions.question: One of the following collocations is an example of tautology.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Three-part trilogy

questions.question: The Great Pyramid of Giza, one of the most famous symbols of Ancient Egypt, is also the tomb of this emperor.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Khufu

questions.question: He was the father of the mythical founders of Ancient Rome -- Romulus and Remus.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mars

questions.question: The first ever flight of Concorde took place in this year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1969

questions.question: The number of letters in the Greek alphabet.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 24

questions.question: Absolute zero is characterised as this temperature.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: −273.15 °C

questions.question: Peter Deunov is the founder of the Danovism movement and the Universal White Brotherhood. He was born in Bulgaria, but from 1888 to 1895 he studied medicine and theology in this US city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Boston
